comments.text:
I started to work on SM bug 632860,
I filed FF bug 632893.

Iirc, there was a decision not to provide Cx shorthands (globally) in SeaMonkey.
(I wonder whether we would have a bug to add them in "SeaMonkey test harness"? Or would want that?)

Yet, I would assume Services.jsm should be available "globally" (as in Firefox), should it not?
As in /suite tests should not need to import it explicitly.
comments.author: bugzillamozillaorg_serge_20140323@gautherie.fr
comments.creator: bugzillamozillaorg_serge_20140323@gautherie.fr
comments.raw_text:
I started to work on SM bug 632860,
I filed FF bug 632893.

Iirc, there was a decision not to provide Cx shorthands (globally) in SeaMonkey.
(I wonder whether we would have a bug to add them in "SeaMonkey test harness"? Or would want that?)

Yet, I would assume Services.jsm should be available "globally" (as in Firefox), should it not?
As in /suite tests should not need to import it explicitly.
